dialogues.text: -Easy, kids! Cut it out. Everybody in. Boat leaves in two minutes. He shoves them in - Audrey first. CLARK ia (continuing) ...0r perhaps you don’t want to see the second larges ball of twine on the face of the earth... which is less than four short hours away. He closes the door, winking at Ellen, kisses her on the f helps her in, closes her door and skips jauntily around t driver's side. He gets in and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OC The car winds its way through the high mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is fresh, the day is new. Audrey's listening to the walk-man. Rusty's playing pac man. Edna is changing her dress shields. It is quiet except for an ' annoying RATTLE somewhere in the car.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Do you hear that rattle?

dialogues.speaker: , ELLEN
dialogues.text: Where's it coming from? '

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Beats the heck out of me. I've been ’ looking for it since we left. It's , driving me crazy. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: be (as A highway patrol motorcycle is behind the station wag with its lights ablaze. He blows his HORN, hits the SIREN. The wagon continues on oblivious to the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycle pulls up alongside Clark's window. He doesn't notice. The COP waves for him to pull over.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Huh? Out of the corner of his eye he catches the motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, shoot! Now what did we do? Audrey's eyes bulge. The dope! Someone found out and called the cops! She looks at her purse with dread. The B43 car slows down and eases off the road. The car stops. Nn Cop gets out of the car and walks back to the station Audrey hands her purse to Aunt Edna. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Will you hold my purse?

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Huh? Clark rolls down his window and smiles pleasantly.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: {innocently) What's the problem, Officer? The Cop is tough and angry. He's ready to kill. His helmet and glasses have small droplets of dried blood on them. coP Out of the car. Clark swallows hard and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark is puzzled as to why the Cop is so mad.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I don't think I was speeding... Was I weaving or something?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, sir. If I wasn't in uniform, I'd split your skull with the butt of my revolver faster than you could say police brutality. Clark is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Officer, w-whatever I've done, I'm sure I can expalin... The Cop drags him around to the right rear bumper and points to the ground. In the background a small amount of dried blood is splattered on the motorcycle wind- shield.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Explain that, you son of a bitch. Clark's mouth drops open, his eyes bulge. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: C) Rusty's face is plastered in the back window of the wa

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Oh my God. } He bends down and picks up the end of a frayed leash. cop You know what the penalty for animal cruelty is in this state?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: {in shock) No, sir. CoP (long pause) Well... It's probably pretty stiff.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (quivering voice) My God, you can't think I'd do that on purpose! I tied him to the bumper when I packed the car. It was confusing. I forgot. Jesus, I'm sorry. I feel The Cop relents. terrible. CoP How do you think the dog feels, sir?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I told you I'm sorry. It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: All right, I can buy that, sir. But it's a shame. (shakes his head sadly) I had a pooch like that when I was a kid. He unhooks the leash from the bumper.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'd say the poor little guy kept up with you for a mile or so... tough little bowser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark's face is drawn and pale. Ellen is biting a knuckle.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: I was afraid you'd get pulled over. You've been exceeding the speed limit for thousands of miles.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Dad wasn't speeding, Aunt Edna. The cop stopped us because... Ellen turns quickly to cut Rusty off.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: He was speeding, Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: No, he wasn't...

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Russ! Listen to your mother! I was speeding. I was driving like a maniac and we can be thankful that the police stopped us. Cop appears at Clark's window on his motorcycle. He hands Clark the leash. CoP Here's the leash, sir. I'm going to go back and get the rest of the carcass off the road.

dialogues.speaker: EDNA
dialogues.text: Her eyes show a shocking realization. As we zoom slowly to her full face, tears well up in her. MUSIC builds with the moment. She takes a gasping breath, sheds a tear, and belches.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: (with a noticable lack of care) That's one, Clark.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: En ns ISIE IES II DL EE ©

dialogues.text: The car is parked in a drive-in restaurant. A WAITRESS approaches the car, struggling under the weight of a heavy tray loaded with food baskets and root beer mugs. Clark rolls his window down halfway to accommodate the clip-on tray. /

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: This your idea of a good restaurant, dog killer? _

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I'm sure the food's fine, Edna. '

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (to waitress) Got it?

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS '
dialogues.text: Uh, huh... She hooks the tray on the window and lets go of it. The tray SNAPS THE WINDOW glass in half and CRASHES to the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is back on the highway headed for Cortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is quiet once again. Ellen is asleep in the front seat. Aunt Edna is asleep in back, snoring and gurgling. Audrey is reading a book: and eating shoestring licorice which she has threaded up through her shirt collar, behind her ear and into her mouth so that Rusty won't see. Clark is driving, it's boring and his mind is wandering. The erotic moan of the Ferrari engine in the distance perks him up. Then as if out of nowhere, the Ferrari appears in his mirror. he glances over quickly to see that Ellen's asleep. Then he whips out his comb and adjus his hairstyle, combing it forward. He wipes his mouth and adjusts his shirt. He puts his arm up and flexes his bisc (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oN — Nad

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Ferrari zooms up beside the car. Clark glances over, thinking he's Robert Mitchum. The Girl waves to him. He winks at her. She lifts up her left leg and puts her foot up on the seat. Her skirt falls off her knee, exposing the full leg. ' Clark swallows hard, beads of sweat begin to form‘on his forehead. The girl puts the Ferrari in neutral and revs the engine. Clark laughs to himself. He can play her game. He puts his car in neutral and revs his cheesy six cylinders. She revs hers.again, a sexy grow- ling high-performance MOAN. Clark floors the station wagon. It Buzzes like a vacuum cleaner and dies. The Ferrari HORN BEEPS and the car surges ahead. ) The station wagon coasts down the road. Clark tries the engine. No go. He finds it next to impossible to steer it. It rolls off the road in a big lazy arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silence awakens the family. They look around, get their bearings. Ellen looks at Clark, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I don't know. The engine just died on me. He tries the starter RRRRR! .RRRRR! Ellen notices his hair. She notices the sweat and the flush in his face.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: What happened to your hair? Why are you sweating? You're blushing? The engine kicks in and Clark puts it in gear.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Don't be silly.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Are you alright, Clark?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Me? Oh, hell yes. Fine. Having a ball. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tne i rn, DR A EI I I I I a a a ame ine a a em = Re San

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As dusk approaches, Ellen cuddles up next to Clark.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN -
dialogues.text: Isn't that a beautiful sunset?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Looks like cheap wallpaper. oer ELLEN Come on, Clark. Look at those mountains. Smell this air. Could you put on a happy face for me? Clark breaks down. He puts his arm around her and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I guess there isn't much more that could happen to us.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I hope not. They kiss tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two suitcases slide off the back and hit the pavement as the car goes over a small bump. The car continues into the sunset. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is in the car except Clark and Ellen, who are approching from the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Clark, we've gotta go back and at least look for those bags. My credit cards are in them.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Ellen. Number one, there's no chance we'd find them when we don't know where they fell off. B, I've got my cards and we've still got plenty of cash... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: No we don't. You gave Eddie $500, and everything on this... "safari" has cost twice as much as you figured out.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: There's nothing in that luggage we can't replace except for your diaphragm, and I can always cash a check down the road. Don't you trust me honey?

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: As long as you don't tie me to the rear bumper. She gets in the car. Clark That hurt, Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is looking at the map. Aunt Edna is clipping her nails. Rusty is listening to the walk-man. Audrey is hit in the eye by a flying nail. Clark is shaving with a portable electric razor plugged into the cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ouch! My eye.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Clark. I think we're lost. Through the rear window we see a view of the Eiffel Tower

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: We're not lost, Ellen. Please let me do the driving. As soon as the engine cools. down, it's: “Grand Canyon, look out!"

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: But Clark, the highway we were on said Grand Canyon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: And I said this is a short cut I worked out a long time ago on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I honestly do not think you're going to find the Grand Canyon off this road.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's only the biggest goddamn hole in the world!

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: Watch your language, Clark. Where were you brought up? In the jungle?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Make that the second biggest.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Can we just go, already?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Shut-up, Audrey. Clark starts engine and pulls away, revealing a bill- board advertising a Las Vegas hotel revue with a collage of dancing girls, the Eiffel Tower, etc..

dialogues.speaker: ROAD
dialogues.text: The station wagon is speeding down an unmarked, unimprove road leading from nowhere to nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Dad, I haven't seen a car for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Shut-up Audrey. You don't think Dad knows where he's going?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Thank you, Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Re  —————————————eeer = _ ee SSS RS ee aa Ke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark is hunched over the wheel looking out across the wasted landscape.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: You're lost! . !

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ma. I saw some detour signs.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I didn't. '

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I saw them when you and Mom were trying to fold the map.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (turning around) Audrey, when they close a road they put up big signs... He looks back at the road breifly.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) .--Like this one. We see horrified faces of the family as the car flies past a huge "Road Closed" sign, and flies off a five foot cliff. The road ends abruptly at a wash. The car sails off the cliff and lands in the wash. The hood and doors pop open, the front tires EXPLODE. The luggage atop the car goes flying, Clark's golf clubs scatter.

dialogues.speaker: SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: Clark's glasses fly off his face. The luggage inside the car slides forward and a suitcase smacks Aunt Edna in the back of the head. She spits out her dentures. Rusty, who had his finger in his nose at impact, drives the digit up his nose to mid-knuckle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The radiator HISSES and sprays. The family sits stunned for a moment. Then all hell breaks loose!

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: (toothless yammer) My bones! My bones!

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: I think I broke my nose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finger in his nose) I stabbed my brain!

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Where are my glasses? Ellen?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I just got my period. Clark retrieves the broken halves of his glasses. They've split at the nose bridge. He reaches down on the floor and picks up Edna's dentures.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Here's somebody's teeth. As he gets out, the air bag inflates again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark is standing on the roof of the car. He is wrapping his glasses with adhesive tape. He carefully slides them onto his head. :

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Ellen helps Audrey out of the car. She walks bow-legged.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: (to Clark) We're going to find a bush. Rusty staggers out and up on the roof with a huge plug of Kleenex in his nose and head held back. ‘He looks back over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: Gee, Dad. You jumped this thing about 50 yards. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: / It's nothing to be proud of... / (to himself, with / some wonderment) 7 50 yards... I'd say we're about 4 three hundred miles from the near- est tow truck.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: Ellen, help me out of here, will you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Stay in the car! It's hot and angerous out here! .

dialogues.speaker: AUNT EDNA
dialogues.text: Don't you tell me what to do! I'll do what I want! I should never have come on this trip. I should have taken an airplane. (continuing; crazy toothless yammer) You shouldn't even have a license to operate an automobile! You Le should be behind bars! Aunt Edna pulls herself up off the seat. Ellen puts a hand on her head and shoves her back in.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: Edna, sit down and shut-up. Move out of that seat again and I'll split your lip!

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Rusty? Come on up here. He sees that Rusty is already there.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh! Russ, I'm going to have to hike down the road and find a service station. I want you to take care of things here.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: You'll be okay, won't you, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Listen, I haven't had much chance to talk man-to-man with you.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I've only been a man for a few days, Dad. Clark smiles proudly and tousles Rusty's hair. They. sit.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: You're growing up so damn fast. I've spent fifteen years of my life at the lab developing newer and better food additives and I guess I've missed an awful lot. You know, at first I didn't want to take this vacation, but I'm glad now that I did. Because it's let me spend a lot of time with you and Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: oo It's been real fun for me, too, ‘ Dad. Except for Aunt Edna.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: She doesn't mean to be a pain in the rump, that's just the way she is. Let's not let her spoil our fun.

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: I won't, Dad. Maybe she'd be a nicer person if she had a family of her own that she lived with instead of always having to glom onto somebody else's.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: You're a pretty smart little guy. Excuse me, man. He laughs a little too hard, cries, and hugs Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) You know what I'd like to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hoy

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Clark gets down off the car taking Rusty with him. He reaches into the car, pulls out a can of beer and leads Rusty to a natural scenic lookout.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) When I was about your age, my dad shared a beer with me and I thought it was just about the best thing in the world. He pops the top, sips the beer and hands it to Rusty. Rusty chugs it.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) When I was a boy, every summer we'd take a vacation. And you know, in eighteen years... He takes the can from Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing; sadly) ..-We never had fun. He puts the empty can to his lips. He realizes it's empty He looks at it, shakes it and looks at Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But now I have my own family and we're on our vacation and you know what?

dialogues.speaker: RUSTY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (determined) We're going to have fun. He crushes the empty beer can.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't let your mother catch you with that beer on you breath. She'll take it out on me. Well, I better get a move on if I'm going to get us out of here before dark. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He slaps Rusty on the back.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Good talk, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark goes back to the car. Ellen is sitting in the front looking at the map. Audrey is lying on a blanket in the sun listening to the walk-man. Edna is in the back seat with a wet towel on her head. The doors are still open.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) I just had a good talk with Rusty. You'll be in good hands here.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: (perplexed) Clark? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: There's got to be a phone or a gas station somewhere around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes scan a barren wasteland.

dialogues.speaker: ELLEN
dialogues.text: All right, honey. But if you're not back in an hour, I'm gonna... Clark hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. You'll be fine. I'm sure this happens all the time and a patrol car will be along in minutes. He jogs off toward Monument Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark is walking jauntily, and singing to keep up his spirits.  “

dialogues.text: MRMRSRARSBERS Eo 3 . = ios SR ak a nn eR 8, 79.

dialogues.text: Sitting from left to right with blank, exhausted expressi are Ellen, Audrey, who's holding her stomach, Aunt Edna w her broken dentures upside down in her mouth, and Rusty playing a pinball machine in the back. dialogues.text: I never heard of no one so shit- all stupid as you driving off a road. You musta got manure fer your brains! They Men roar with laughter. Clark forces a smile.

dialogues.text: How much ya got? ' CLARK i I'm asking how much the repairs , ! are. } “MECHANIC And I'm asking how much ya got.

dialogues.text: (grins) 'Cause I'm going to charge you all the money you got. Clark is outraged.
